## Loading the data

This project is so interesting and relevant to my life!

```{r, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(scales)
library(ggplot2)
load("house_elections.rda")
load("candidates.rda")
load("committees.rda")
load("contributions.rda")
load("individuals.rda")
```


```{r}
#selecting variables from raw datasets
indiv <- individuals %>% select(cmte_id, transaction_amt, occupation, employer, state) %>% filter(state=="MA")
comit <- committees %>% select(cmte_id, cmte_name, cmte_type, cmte_party_affiliation, org_type)

#recoding org_type
comit$org_type[comit$org_type=="C"] <- "Corporation"
comit$org_type[comit$org_type=="L"] <- "Labor organization"
comit$org_type[comit$org_type=="M"] <- "Membership organization"
comit$org_type[comit$org_type=="T"] <- "Trade association"
comit$org_type[comit$org_type=="V"] <- "Cooperative"
comit$org_type[comit$org_type=="W"] <- "Corporation without capital stock"
comit$org_type[comit$org_type==" "] <- "NA"

#join
df <- indiv %>% left_join(comit, by ="cmte_id")
df <- df %>% group_by(org_type) %>% summarise(summ=sum(transaction_amt)) %>% filter(org_type %in% c("Corporation", "Labor organization", "Membership organization", "Trade association", "Cooperative", "Corporation without capital stock"))
ggplot(df, aes(x=factor(org_type), y=summ)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", aes(fill=factor(org_type)))

```

```{r}
comit2 <- comit %>% select(cmte_id, cmte_party_affiliation, org_type)
df2 <- merge(x=indiv, y=comit2, by= "cmte_id", all=TRUE)
df2 <- df2 %>% filter(org_type %in% c("Corporation", "Labor organization", "Membership organization", "Trade association", "Cooperative", "Corporation without capital stock"))
df2_summ <- merge(x=df2, y=df, by ="org_type", all=TRUE) %>% filter(state %in% c("MA"))

```



```{r}
ggplot(df2_summ, aes(x=factor(org_type), y=summ, fill=cmte_party_affiliation)) + geom_bar(position="dodge",stat="identity")
```
